meanings.definition: Attracting or tempting by offering pleasure or advantage
meanings.sent1: The enticing smell of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The colorful candy display at the store was very enticing.
meanings.sent3: The enticing aroma of popcorn made everyone in the cinema hungry.
meanings.sent4: The enticing glow of the campfire drew everyone closer.
meanings.sent5: The enticing promise of a surprise kept the children excited all day.

meanings.definition: Alluring or appealing to the senses or desires
meanings.sent1: The enticing music lured people to the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The enticing view from the mountaintop was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The enticing flavors of the new ice cream left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The enticing colors of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The enticing touch of the soft fabric made her want to buy the dress.
